intro: Parnassia kumaonica, commonly known as the Kumaon parnassia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its striking white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces a cluster of small, yellowish sepals beneath the flowers. Parnassia kumaonica is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often found in alpine meadows.
